alert.note: Alert for Highland; Pike; Ross (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 3:47PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN PIKE, SOUTHEASTERN HIGHLAND AND SOUTHWESTERN ROSS COUNTIES THROUGH 415 PM EDT... At 347 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Belfast, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph, half inch hail, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Hillsboro, Marshall, Bainbridge, Kincaid Springs, Belfast, Rocky Fork Point, Cynthiana, Highland Holiday, New Market, Sinking Spring, Rocky Fork Lake, Rainsboro, Paint Creek State Park, Berrysville, State Route 136 at US Route 62 and Highland County Airport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
